content.location: On the cliff band left of Bulbous, and around the corner. It's not visible from the scree between Bulbous and the cliff band

content.description: Climb left side of face on thin holds, avoiding the left arete.
content.location: Just left of Three Step/Wednesday Nighter.

content.description: Start in the crack, then move up and left.
content.location: Same start as Wednesday Nighter, but moves left.

content.description: Sit start on large ledge and move up shallow dihedral with thin holds to top out.
content.location: Left of Two Step, right of Crimp Overhang.

content.description: Climb up pyramid shaped face on thin holds to a big dyno to jug.
content.protection: Many pads and spotters for sure, bad landing.
content.location: Just left from Wednesday Nighter wall on cliff band.

content.description: Climb the right arête of the Bulbous Boulder from a sit with a big left side pull and a slot on the right side of the arête.  More or less a direct finish to Final Cut.  A couple pinches on Bulbous below the lip probably won't be used.
content.location: The Bulbous Boulder. Walk to top of Balanced Rock trail. Walk east 100ish feet, drop down the south side of the bluff 100ish feet and you will be there.  Look for the west facing nose like feature of the boulder.

content.description: From a sit on the right arête of the Bulbous boulder, left hand on obvious juggy sidepull, and right on a low decent sidepull slot.  Pull through the center of the roof and join Bulbous to finish.
content.protection: 3 pads is nice or you could have a buddy move them.

content.description: A Classic hardman problem!  Start on good hold at base of overhang and make big moves to good pinches.  Technique and power get you up this one.  Top out right along the lip.
content.location: Just downhill and southeast of the BR trail and EB trail junction.

content.description: Start on good hold at the base of overhang.  Move out left to pinches and finish out the top.
content.location: At trail junction for BR Trail and EB Trail, walk east and head down toward talus. You should see the back of Bulbous from above.

content.description: Strong handholds, with quick access to trails back to bottom. Great for first time out, but bring pads for your protection. Rentals with Wisconsin Climbing Association in Madison is great.
content.location: Top of the bluffs on Balanced Rock trail, take an eastern user path instead of continuing onto the Ice Age Trail. Bring lots of water for the summer, long way back to the base.

content.description: At the top of the Balanced Rock trail, the short cliffline to the east (climber's right) and a boulder just below.
